sen.j: 在原 行平（ありわら の ゆきひら、弘仁9年（818年） - 寛平5年7月19日 (旧暦)（893年9月6日））は平安時代の日本の歌人、公家。
sen.e: ARIWARA no Yukihira (818 - September 6, 893 (lunar calendar)) was a Japanese poet and a court noble who lived in the Heian Period.
ARIWARA no Yukihira (818 - September 6, 893 (lunar calendar)) was a Japanese poet and a court noble who lived in the Heian Period.
ARIWARA no Yukihira (818 - September 6, 893) was a Japanese poet and a court noble who lived in the Heian period.
sen.cmt: (lunar calendar)削除しました。新暦のみ表記。period小文字にしました。

sen.j: 在中納言（ざいちゅうなごん）とも。
sen.e: He was also called Zai Chunagon (middle counselor).
He was also called Zai Chunagon (middle counselor).
He was also called Zai Chunagon (middle counselor).

sen.j: 平城天皇の皇子阿保親王の次男。
sen.e: He was the second son of the Imperial Prince Abo who was a son of the Emperor Heizei.
He was the second son of the Imperial Prince Abo who was a son of the Emperor Heizei.
He was the second son of the Imperial Prince Abo who was a son of the Emperor Heizei.

sen.j: 在原業平は弟。
sen.e: ARIWARA no Narihira was Yukihira's younger brother.
ARIWARA no Narihira was Yukihira's younger brother.
ARIWARA no Narihira was Yukihira's younger brother.

sen.j: 母は不明、桓武天皇皇女伊都内親王（業平の母）説もあるが、生年から考えるに史実ではない。
sen.e: His mother was not known; there is a view that his mother was the Imperial Princess Itonai (Narihira's mother), who was a daughter of the Emperor Kanmu, but, judging from his year of birth, it cannot be the historical fact.

His mother was not known; there is a view that his mother was the Imperial Princess Itonai (Narihira's mother), who was a daughter of the Emperor Kanmu, but, judging from his year of birth, it cannot be the historical fact.

His mother was not known; there is a view that his mother was the Imperial Princess Itonai (Narihira's mother), who was a daughter of the Emperor Kanmu, but, judging from his year of birth, it cannot be the historical fact.

sen.j: 兄弟とともに臣籍降下して在原氏を名乗る。
sen.e: Both of brothers assumed the status of subject and took the name of ARIWARA.
Both brothers assumed the status of subject and took the name of ARIWARA.
Both brothers assumed the status of subject and took the name of ARIWARA.

sen.j: このとき九歳。
sen.e: He was nine years old at that time.
He was nine years old at that time.
He was nine years old at that time.

sen.j: 娘文子は清和天皇更衣 (女官)、貞数親王母。
sen.e: His daughter, Bunshi was a Koi (consort) of the Emperor Seiwa and she was the mother of the Imperial Prince Sadakazu.
His daughter, Bunshi was a Koi (consort) of the Emperor Seiwa and she was the mother of the Imperial Prince Sadakazu.
His daughter, Bunshi was a Koi (consort) of the Emperor Seiwa and she was the mother of the Imperial Prince Sadakazu.

sen.j: 承和の変後急死した阿保親王の子息のうち、また当時の官吏としては、比較的順調な昇進ぶりを示し、特に民政に才を発揮した。
sen.e: Among sons of the Imperial Prince Abo who died suddenly after the Jowa Incident, and as a government official at that time, he was promoted rather favorably and he brought his ability for civil administration into full play.

Among the sons of the Imperial Prince Abo who died suddenly after the Jowa Incident, and as a government official at that time, he was promoted rather favorably as he brought his ability for civil administration into full play.

Among the sons of the Imperial Prince Abo who died suddenly after the Jowa Incident, and as a government official at that time, he was promoted rather favorably as he brought his ability for civil administration into full play.

sen.j: 840年仁明天皇の蔵人に任じられ、侍従などをつとめた。
sen.e: In 840, he was appointed to a Kurodo (emperor's secretary) for the Emperor Ninmyo and worked as a Jiju (chamberlain).
In 840, he was appointed to a Kurodo (emperor's secretary) for the Emperor Ninmyo and worked as a Jiju (chamberlain).
In 840, he was appointed to a Kurodo (emperor's secretary) for the Emperor Ninmyo and worked as a Jiju (chamberlain).

sen.j: 文徳天皇の代に855年正月の除目により従四位下に進むと同時に因幡国守を拝任。
sen.e: In the Emperor Montoku's era, by jimoku (ceremony to appoint officials) in January 855, he was promoted to Jushiige (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and he assumed the position of Inaba no kuni no kami (the governor of Inaba Province).

In the Emperor Montoku's era, by jimoku (ceremony to appoint officials) in January 855, he was promoted to Jushiige (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and he assumed the position of Inaba no kuni no kami (the governor of Inaba Province).

In the Emperor Montoku's era, by jimoku (ceremony to appoint officials) in January 855, he was promoted to Jushiige (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and he assumed the position of Inaba no kuni no kami (the governor of Inaba Province).

sen.j: 小倉百人一首に取られる和歌はこのとき下向に際してのものである。
sen.e: His waka (thirty-one-syllable Japanese poem) taken into Ogura Hyakunin Isshu (The Ogura sequence of one hundred poems by one hundred poets) was made on his way to Inaba Province on this occasion.
His waka (thirty-one-syllable Japanese poem) taken into Ogura Hyakunin Isshu (The Ogura sequence of one hundred poems by one hundred poets) was made on his way to Inaba Province on this occasion.
His waka (thirty-one-syllable Japanese poem) taken into Ogura Hyakunin Isshu (The Ogura sequence of one hundred poems by one hundred poets) was made on his way to Inaba Province on this occasion.

sen.j: のち2年余りで帰京、以後は京官と地方官をともども歴任する。
sen.e: After two years and more, he returned to Kyoto and, then, he successively assumed various positions of kyokan (official of the Capital) and chihokan (local official).
After two years, he returned to Kyoto and, then successively assumed various positions of kyokan (official of the Capital) and chihokan (local official).
After two years, he returned to Kyoto and, then successively assumed various positions of kyokan (official of the Capital) and chihokan (local official).

sen.j: 古今和歌集によれば文徳天皇のとき、須磨に蟄居を余儀なくされた。
sen.e: According to "Kokin Wakashu" (Collection of Ancients and Modern Poems), he was obliged to confine himself to his house in Suma in the Emperor Montoku's era.
According to "Kokin Wakashu" (Collection of Ancients and Modern Poems), he was obliged to confine himself to his house in Suma during Emperor Montoku's era.
According to "Kokin Wakashu" (Collection of Ancients and Modern Poems), he was obliged to confine himself to his house in Suma during Emperor Montoku's era.

sen.j: 蟄居の理由などの詳細は不明である（須磨に流されていたとき、松風、村雨という姉妹の海女を愛したという伝説が謡曲『松風 (能)』などに伝えられている）。
sen.e: The reason and other details of this confinement are not known (The Noh chant "Matsukaze" recorded the legend that he loved women divers, Matsukaze and Murasame, who were sisters, when he was exiled to Suma.
The reasons for his confinement are not known (The Noh chant "Matsukaze" recorded the legend that he loved women divers, Matsukaze and Murasame, who were sisters, when he was exiled to Suma.)
The reasons for his confinement are not known (The Noh chant "Matsukaze" recorded the legend that he loved women divers, Matsukaze and Murasame, who were sisters, when he was exiled to Suma.).
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足しました。

sen.j: また須磨滞在時に寂しさを紛らわすために浜辺に流れ着いた木片から一弦琴、須磨琴を製作したとも伝えられている。
sen.e: It is also recorded that he made suma-goto, which is single-string zither, with blocks of wood that had drifted ashore in order to distract himself from his loneliness during his stay in Suma.
It is also recorded that he made suma-goto, which is single-string zither, with blocks of wood that had drifted ashore in order to distract himself from his loneliness during his stay in Suma.
It is also recorded that he made suma-goto, which is single-string zither, with blocks of wood that had drifted ashore in order to distract himself from his loneliness during his stay in Suma.

sen.j: 清和天皇のとき862年（貞観四年）従四位上。
sen.e: In the Emperor Seiwa's era, he was promoted to Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) in 862.
In the Emperor Seiwa's era, he was promoted to Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) in 862.
In the Emperor Seiwa's era, he was promoted to Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) in 862.

sen.j: 蔵人頭などを務め、陽成天皇のとき中納言に上った。
sen.e: He served as the Kurodo no To (chief official of the emperor's secretaries) and he was promoted to the Chunagon (middle counselor) in the era of the emperor Yozei.
He served as the Kurodo no To (chief official of the emperor's secretaries) and was promoted to Chunagon (middle counselor) druing the era of the emperor Yozei.
He served as the Kurodo no To (chief official of the emperor's secretaries) and was promoted to Chunagon (middle counselor) during the era of the Emperor Yozei.
sen.cmt: duringスペル訂正しました。Emperor大文字にしました。

sen.j: 行平中納言、在中納言などの呼称はこれによる。
sen.e: His nicknames "Yukihira Chunagon" and "Zai Chunagon" came from this position.
His nicknames "Yukihira Chunagon" and "Zai Chunagon" came from this position.
His nicknames "Yukihira Chunagon" and "Zai Chunagon" came from this position.

sen.j: のち民部卿・大宰権帥などを務め、887年に70歳で致仕。
sen.e: Later, he served as the Minbukyo (Taxation Minister) and the Dazai Gon no Sochi (chief of the Dazaifu) and retired in 887 at the age of seventy..
Later, he served as Minbukyo (Taxation Minister) and the Dazai Gon no Sochi (chief of the Dazaifu) and retired in 887 at the age of seventy.
Later, he served as Minbukyo (Taxation Minister) and the Dazai Gon no Sochi (chief of the Dazaifu) and retired in 887 at the age of seventy.

sen.j: そのときの官位は正三位。
sen.e: At that time, his rank was Shosanmi (Senior Thirt Rank).
At that time, his rank was Shosanmi (Senior Thirt Rank).
At that time, his rank was Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).
sen.cmt: Third スペル訂正しました。

sen.j: 歌人としては古今和歌集ほかに合計11首入集し、また民部卿行平歌合（在民部卿家歌合）を880年代中頃に主催した。
sen.e: As a poet, eleven waka of Yukihira were chosen for "Kokin Wakashu" and other collections and he held Minbukyo Yukihira utaawase (waka-matching) (Zai Minbukyo-ke utaawase) in the middle of 880s
As a poet, eleven waka of Yukihira were chosen for "Kokin Wakashu" and other collections and he held Minbukyo Yukihira utaawase (waka-matching) (Zai Minbukyo-ke utaawase) in the middle of 880s
As a poet, eleven waka of Yukihira were chosen for "Kokin Wakashu" and other collections and he held Minbukyo Yukihira utaawase (waka-matching) (Zai Minbukyo-ke utaawase) in the middle of 880s

sen.j: これは現存する最古の歌合である。
sen.e: This is the oldest utaawase that we can see in the history.
This is the oldest utaawase that we can see in history.
This is the oldest utaawase that we can see in history.

sen.j: 881年（元慶5年）在原氏の学問所として大学別曹奨学院を創設した。
sen.e: In 881, he established a daigakubesso, which was called Shogakuin, as a gakumonsho (school) for the Arihara clan.
In 881, he established a daigakubesso, which was called Shogakuin, as a gakumonsho (school) for the Arihara clan.

sen.cmt: 全角スペースを半角にしました。

sen.j: これは朱雀大路東、三条大路の北一町を占め、住居を与えて大学寮を目指す子弟を教育したもので、当時は藤原氏の勧学院と並んで著名であった。
sen.e: Shogakuin occupied a town that was located to the east of Suzaku-oji and the north of Sanjo-oji and it was used to provide residences to and educate children who wanted to enter daigakuryo and it was well known together with Kangakuin of the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 奨学院は醍醐天皇のとき、大学寮の南曹とされた。
sen.e: Shogakuin was changed to Nanso (the Southern school of the daigakuryo in the Emperor Daigo's era.
Shogakuin was changed to Nanso (the Southern school of the daigakuryo in the Emperor Daigo's era.

In 871, removed from Bicchu no kami.

sen.j: 872年（貞観14）8月25日、蔵人頭を兼帯（参議にして蔵人頭を兼帯する珍しい例）。
sen.e: On August 25, 872, also assumed the position of Kurodo no To (Dual appointment as the Sangi and the Kurodo no To was a rare case.)
On August 25, 872, also assumed the position of Kurodo no To (Dual appointment as the Sangi and the Kurodo no To was a rare case.)
On October 5, 872, also assumed the position of Kurodo no To (Dual appointment as the Sangi and the Kurodo no To was a rare case.)

sen.j: 8月29日、左衛門督を兼任。
sen.e: On August 29, also assumed the position of Saemon no Kami (captain of Headquarters of Outer Palace Guard).
On August 29, also assumed the position of Saemon no Kami (captain of Headquarters of Outer Palace Guard).
On October 9, also assumed the position of Saemon no kami (captain of Headquarters of Outer Palace Guard).
sen.cmt: 新暦に訂正しました。kami小文字にしました。

sen.j: 左兵衛督を去る。
sen.e: Removed from the Sahyoe no Kami.
Removed from the Sahyoe no Kami.
Removed from the Sahyoe no kami.

sen.j: 873年（貞観15）12月18日、従三位に昇叙し、大宰権帥を兼任。
sen.e: On December 18, 873, promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and also assumed the position of Dazai Gon no Sochi.
On December 18, 873, promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and also assumed the position of Dazai Gon no Sochi.
On January 14, 874, promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and also assumed the position of Dazai Gon no Sochi.

sen.j: 参議如元。
sen.e: The position of Sangi remained unchanged.
The position of Sangi remained unchanged.
Retained his position as Sangi.
sen.cmt: 如元→retained his position as に統一しました。

sen.j: 検非違使別当・蔵人頭・左衛門督を去る。
sen.e: Removed from the Kebiishi no Betto, Kurodo no To and Saemon no Kami.
Removed from the Kebiishi no Betto, Kurodo no To and Saemon no Kami.
Removed from the Kebiishi no Betto, Kurodo no To and Saemon no kami.

sen.j: 877年（元慶元）10月18日、治部卿を兼任。
sen.e: On October 18, 877, also assumed the position of the Jibukyo (Civil Administration Minister).
On October 18, 877, also assumed the position of the Jibukyo (Civil Administration Minister).
On Nobember 30, 877, also assumed the position of the Jibukyo (Civil Administration Minister).

sen.j: 参議・大宰権帥如元。
sen.e: The positions of Sangi and Dazai Gon no Sochi remained unchanged.
The positions of Sangi and Dazai Gon no Sochi remained unchanged.
Retained his position as Sangi and Dazai Gon no Sochi.
sen.cmt: 如元→retained his position as に統一しました。

sen.j: 878年（元慶2）2月、大宰権帥を去る。
sen.e: On March, 878, removed from Dazai Gon no Sochi.
sen.cmt: 訳抜け。新暦に訂正しました。

sen.j: 878年（元慶3）10月18日、備中守を兼任。
sen.e: On October 18, 879, also assumed the position of Bicchu no Kami.
On October 18, 879, also assumed the position of Bicchu no Kami.
On November 9, 879, also assumed the position of Bicchu no Kami.
sen.cmt: 新暦に訂正しました。kami小文字にしました。

sen.j: 879年（元慶4）4月18日、近江守を兼任。
sen.e: On April 18, 879, also assumed the position of Omi no Kami.
On April 18, 879, also assumed the position of Omi no Kami.
On June 3, 880, also assumed the position of Omi no kami.
sen.cmt: 新暦に訂正しました。kami小文字にしました。

sen.j: 備中守を去る。
sen.e: Removed from Bicchu no Kami.
Removed from Bicchu no Kami.
Removed from Bicchu no kami.

sen.j: 882年（元慶6）1月10日、中納言に転任。
sen.e: On January 10, 882, transferred to the Chunagon.
On January 10, 882, transferred to the Chunagon.
On February 5, 882, transferred to the Chunagon.

sen.j: 2月23日、正三位に昇叙。
sen.e: On February 23, promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).
On February 23, promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).
On March 20, promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).

sen.j: 中納言如元。
sen.e: The position of Chunagon remained unchanged.
The position of Chunagon remained unchanged.
Retained his position as Chunagon.
sen.cmt: 如元→retained his position as に統一しました。

sen.j: 883年（元慶7）3月19日、民部卿を兼任。
sen.e: On March 19, 883, also assumed the position of the Minbukyo (Taxation Minister).
On March 19, 883, also assumed the position of the Minbukyo (Taxation Minister).
On May 3, 883, also assumed the position of the Minbukyo (Taxation Minister).

sen.j: 885年（元慶9）2月20日、陸奥出羽按察使を兼帯。
sen.e: On February 20, 885, also assumed the position of Mutsu Dewa Azechi (investigator of Mutsu and Dewa Province)
On February 20, 885, also assumed the position of Mutsu Dewa Azechi (investigator of Mutsu and Dewa Province)
On March 14, 885, also assumed the position of Mutsu Dewa Azechi (investigator of Mutsu and Dewa Province).
sen.cmt: 新暦に訂正しました。ピリオド補足しました。

sen.j: 887年（仁和3）4月23日、中納言・民部卿・陸奥出羽按察使を辞任し、致仕。
sen.e: On April 23, 887, resigned from the Chunagon, Minbukyo and Mutsu Dewa Azechi and retired.
On April 23, 887, resigned from the Chunagon, Minbukyo and Mutsu Dewa Azechi and retired.
On May 23, 887, resigned from the Chunagon, Minbukyo and Mutsu Dewa Azechi and retired.
On July 19, 893, he died.
On July 19, 893, he died.
On September 6, 893, he died.

sen.j: 享年75。
sen.e: He was seventy-five years old.
He was seventy-five years old.
He was seventy-five years old.

sen.j: 時に、前中納言正三位。
sen.e: At that time, he was the former Chunagon with Shosanmi rank.
At that time, he was the former Chunagon with Shosanmi rank.
At that time, he was the former Chunagon with Shosanmi rank.
